topic.title: Post Expansion Tasks
topic.shortdesc: After the expansion is completed, you must perform different tasks depending on your environment.

body.p: You must remove the existing expansion schema before you can perform another expansion operation on the Greenplum system.

You can safely remove the expansion schema after the expansion operation is complete and verified. To run another expansion operation on a Greenplum system, first remove the existing expansion schema.

ol.li: Log in on the master host as the user who will be running your Greenplum Database system (for example, gpadmin).
Run the gpexpand utility with the -c option. For example:$ gpexpand -cSome systems require you to press Enter twice.

topic.title: Setting Up PXF on the New Host

body.p: If you are using PXF in your Greenplum Database cluster, you must perform some configuration steps on the new hosts.
There are different steps to follow depending on your PXF version and the type of installation.

ul.li: If you installed the PXF 5.x rpm or deb on your Greenplum cluster, you must install the same version on the new hosts.
If you are using the PXF version included with your Greenplum Database distribution, no install action is required on your part.
Log into the Greenplum Master and run the following commands:gpadmin@gpmaster$ pxf cluster reset gpadmin@gpmaster$ pxf cluster init
If you installed the PXF 6.x rpm or deb on your Greenplum cluster, you must install the same version on the new hosts.
Log into the Greenplum Master and run the following commands: gpadmin@gpmaster$ pxf cluster register gpadmin@gpmaster$ pxf cluster sync
